H0.text: Bass are organisms that would most likely accumulate the highest concentration of contaminants in a polluted lake.

H1.text: Minnows are the organisms most likely to accumulate the highest concentration of contaminants in a polluted lake.

H2.text: Aquatic plants are the organisms most likely to accumulate the highest concentration of contaminants if a lake is polluted.

H3.text: Fish-eating birds would most likely accumulate the highest concentration of contaminants if a lake is polluted.

A4.text: Anything which eats these fish also consumes the higher level of mercury the fish have accumulated.

A5.text: Predatory fish such as swordfish and sharks or birds like osprey and eagles have higher concentrations of mercury in their tissue than could be accounted for by direct exposure alone.
